Not to Incur Debt.--All must practice economy. No worker should manage his affairs in a way to incur debt. The practice of drawing money from the treasury before 
                                                                           94
it is earned, is a snare. In this way the resources are limited, so that laborers cannot be supported in missionary work. When one voluntarily becomes involved in debt, he is entangling himself in one of Satan's nets which he sets for souls.--Manual for Canvassers, p. 65. (1902)
